page.title: 08Mortimer Children
page.content: The following information was gathered from forty-six 4-5 year olds. Twenty- one children were born locally and of these six parents and five grand- parents have always lived in the village. The households range from three to seven people, twenty-four having four, and fifteen five people. Most live in houses built twenty to a hundred years ago and all except one are centrally heated by oil, solid fuel or electricity there being no gas in the village. Twenty also have open fires. All the houses have gardens with trees and flowers and over half grow fruit and vegetables. Only two families do not keep a pet, the most popular being cats and dogs. Within this group only two children did not have between one and two years pre-school experience in either a nursery or kindergarden.
